Tree module¶

Module implementing regression tree

class random_forest.tree.Condition(index, value)¶

Contains information about predictor index and treshold. Needed for branching

index¶

Alias for field number 0

value¶

Alias for field number 1

class random_forest.tree.Config¶

Configuration for using tree module. Overwrite them after importing module to configure tree building variables.

min_split_size¶

Minimum size required for set of date to br further branched

Type

int

number_of_predictors_to_draw¶

Number of predictors which will be randomly drawn, from which the best split condition will be selected. It is recommended to use number higher than number of columns containing uniform data, other wise best split may not be found.

Type

int

class random_forest.tree.Leaf(training_data)¶

Represent Leaf of the Tree. Contains possible values for prediction

class random_forest.tree.Node(training_data)¶

Represents Node of the Tree. Contains Condition to select appropriate subnode (Node or Leaf)

find_best_split(training_data)¶

Finds condition for split that gives lowest Residual Sum of Squares

Parameters

training_data (np.ndarray) – input data

rss(array) → float¶

Residual Sum of Squares

Parameters

array (np.ndarray) – input array

Returns

Residual Sum of Squares

Return type

float

split_data_on_value(data, condition: random_forest.tree.Condition)¶

Splits np.ndarray using condition

Parameters

  • data (np.array) – data to be splitted

  • condition (Condition) – condition of split

Returns

array lesser or equal to condition right_node(np.ndarray): array greater than condition

Return type

left_node(np.ndarray)

class random_forest.tree.Tree(training_data)¶

Object representing regression tree

Parameters

training_data (np.ndarray) – Data from which Tree will be created

predict(data) → float¶

Calculates regression tree prediction

Parameters

  • data (np.ndarray) – data for which prediction will be made.

  • dimension array. Can be one field shorter than training data. (Single) –

Returns

Prediction

Return type

float

random_forest.tree.create_node(training_data)¶

Calls appropriate constructor dependant on training_data size.

Parameters

training_data (np.ndarray) – Data from which node will be created

Returns

Node

Return type

Node, Leaf
